post_text: Paul Martin Newby, Senior Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of North Carolina, visited The Roger Bacon Academy!
shared_text:
The Roger Bacon Academy
March 5 at 10:56 AM ·

Paul Martin Newby, Senior Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of North Carolina, visited The Roger Bacon Academy to speak with Headmaster Laurie Benton and eighth grade history teacher Jorden Ochoa. They discussed teaching the development of our Constitution, separation of powers, and the proper role of the judiciary. Ms. Ochoa emphasized the importance The Roger Bacon Academy curriculum places on these topics and how vital they are to the growth of our students as citizens.

Justice Newby informed us the North Carolina Supreme Court will be holding session in Wilmington in early May, so we are planning field trips for our students to witness the judiciary in action.

Ms. Ochoa, commented, “It was an honor to discuss our school and the Constitution’s continued relevance as originally ratified with Justice Newby. It is important our students know our country’s history and their rights as American citizens. We look forward to attending the North Carolina Supreme Court while it holds session in Wilmington and see our judicial system at work! “
